sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Lévy C curve.
message_1: What is the Hausdorff dimension of the Lévy C curve, which is constructed by recursively replacing each line segment with four smaller copies, where each copy is one-third of the length of the original segment?
message_2:
To find the Hausdorff dimension of the Lévy C curve, we can use the formula:

Hausdorff dimension = log(N) / log(1/s)

where N is the number of self-similar pieces and s is the scaling factor.

In the case of the Lévy C curve, each line segment is replaced by 4 smaller copies (N = 4), and each copy is one-third the length of the original segment (s = 1/3).

So, the Hausdorff dimension is:

Hausdorff dimension = log(4) / log(1/3) ≈ 1.2619

The Hausdorff dimension of the Lévy C curve is approximately 1.2619.
